I said last time that my partner and I have gotten things figured out, and that's still true but in Lab 4 there's things that he did that kind of annoyed me. he wanted to choose something different from the examples because he didn't want to be basic and do what everyone else was doing. He did this in first assignment too where he said he "didn't want to pick low hanging fruit" as he put in the submission. I wanted to go with it because I didn't want to argue but we ended up choosing go fish, which is actually not that simple. I tried to say that it was probably too difficult, but he just said it was fine. I just felt like we just made it harder on ourselves for no reason and he kind of writes of suggestions I have sometimes. It's not a big enough deal where I want to confront him about it because at the end of the day, it's not worth the time and effort for someone I will probably never see again after this (famous last words). Plus, it would be nice to get a new lab partner instead of sticking with the same one the whole time. I'm not really upset by that whole thing, I just feel like I need to switch partners after this or else I'm going to start being upset. Everything's going decently otherwise. >
Are you sure you don't want to try another partner? I admire that your partner is trying to challenge themselves though.

Class is going well and I had a lot of fun with the html and css lab with my partner David and look forward to using it more. The elephant in the room however is that around 4 days ago my Phone was totaled after falling screen first on the concrete after being knocked out of my hand by my friends car door as it swung open. If that wasn't already bad enough I then proceeded to lose access to canvas, my ucsc email, and other resources. This has unfortunately left me behind in class, and my RA duties so now I must play catch-up. It isn't life threatening but it's not ideal. On top of that previous issues in my personal life are still active.

After killing three phones, I went with an expensive bulletproof phone case. Now I can fall off a pier or out of an airplane and my phone will be fine. Make sure to slow down and take care of yourself. It sounds like you are carrying a lot.

While I'm over my illness/allergic reaction caused by the fires, I'm hoping I'm well enough to stay the full time in class. I have a sparse cough, which annoys me as it only appeared while I was nearly recovered from having an extremely sore throat. My throat is pretty much fine now, I have a slight cough but its frequency is very low, as I am keeping hydrated. I've got a mask in case I do cough, to stop the spread of potential germs even though it was the smoke from the fires made me so ill. I'm hoping this gets better soon as I would hope to not be bogged down by it so much. I would have stayed home, but that would have only made things awkward as I stayed home sick last friday and was absent from a class that was not cancelled, which I do not wish to fall behind on for two classes in a row. I plan on stopping by the school pharmacy to get some cough drops as I forgot to pack those when moving back in, and feel like they'll help me remedy my throat.
Good call. These days if you cough in public, you're a criminal. Get better soon.

Shakespeare is my enemy!!!!!!! Struggling in my Shakespeare Lit class but if that's the largest of my stressors at the moment, I can't complain.

Mistress, pray, do heed my humble plea, The Bard, he is no foe to thee or me. With words so deft, he weaves a wondrous spell, Expanding minds, as far as I can tell.
His verses dance like leaves in gentle breeze, A poet's touch, a soul put at ease. To call him enemy would be unjust, For in his art, he's someone we can trust.
He takes us to the realms of ancient lore, And in his tales, we find we long for more. So let not enmity cloud reason's light, The Bard, he guides us through the darkest night.
In knowledge and in art, we both agree, The Bard, a friend, expanding minds, you'll see.

I had fun last week messing around with CSS and seeing what I could do -- I was wondering though what the Spotify embed codes would look like on our sites but I didn't have the time to try it out/didn't know if it would work with HTML. I'm also hoping to apply to some game art and animation summer internships this month which I'm excited about.

It's easy enough to embed stuff on your website. Just get the code from the Spotify website, and drop it into your HTML. 

Next level, though, you can control a spotify embed with javascript! It takes some doing, and it's a bit dodgy, but if you're into it, I'd be happy to show you how. An opportunity for an office hours appointment.

I'm okay the work load is starting to get to me. I went to the Rally and Vigil on Monday for SJP and thats the first time it felt "real" to me, not saying it wasn't before but I'm lucky to live in the US and I feel like with all the false information and propaganda being spread it feels sorta surreal. Seeing everyone come together was a super emotional experience and seeing some of my friends suffering and loosing contact with their friend and family is scary and so unsettling.

At first I thought you were talking about the Israel/Palestine situation then I was like, wait, what's SJP? Something going on with Sarah Jessica Parker?

For real though, it is hard to watch suffering and oppression, and not want to get involved somehow.

Last night I was working on a graphic and it got really late and by the time I was ready to go to bed I realized there was a clunking sound in my kitchen. Soon I realized it was the MOUSE  that has been terrorizing out house for the past few days. So I made my roommate come out and be scared with me. Then we built two mouse traps and went to bed around 5am. It was also really cold last night like I can't remember the last time I was that cold.

I can empathize. I really like both mice and rats personally, but their tendency to be destructive makes it hard to live with them. Chewing walls and wiring, leaving smelly areas makes them terrible roommates.

I might be getting sick-wait no! I am NOT getting sick. My throat just hurts because my roommates are sick. I just got over a cold though. I will not let myself get any sicker. I am trying to finish all my work and out a sense of urgency in my step. I need to grind this out! I feel happy, but I and still looking for fulfillment in other places of my life. I feel optimistic about the summer.  I can't wait to live w my parents again hahahaha they are my therapist and I feel very comforted when around them. They are not actually my therapists but talking to them always makes me feel better. I am going to do so many projects this summer that I am hyped about. I am going to make a dress out of a big button up shirt that I have, make mini books, and experiment with apparel made out of brown paper bags. I will miss this class.

I hope you didn't get sick. That's rad to have such a trusting relationship with your parents. I hope you have a great summer. Write down all these things you want to do now before you forget. I will miss having you as a student.

I worked on my final project on Sunday. I sat outside 11th hour and partially brought my conceptual piece to life! I asked people to write down the time and one dream/ passion/ goal they want to accomplish in their life. My goal was to incite discussion about the concept of infinite time, yet we often squander our finite time/ put the things we really want to do off/ assume we have more time. This was definitely out of my comfort zone as I struggle with public speaking/ talking to people I don't know (but that's what I wanted to accomplish with this final piece). I spent about 4 hours collecting responses and filled a whole page with people from the community's messages. I was hoping to hang up this paper and a blank one (so people viewing open studio pieces can also include a response). Let me know if that's a realistic possibility and I'll include a blank paper and pens with my project.
This sounds great. I'm proud of the work you put into it.

Regarding what I wrote about last time, my partner apologized because they assumed that I was just going to make them do all the work. They assumed that because of past experiences, but I still think it's obvious not to just make that assumption especially when I had already done a good amount of work thus far. We're staying partners for the next assignment but I still don't fully forgive them or trust them. Part of it is what I just said but also he didn't mention the fact that he insulted my work and rewrote the entire thing just because he felt like it didn't meet the requirements. I truly think that he felt like he could do a better job because he thinks his writing is so much superior. I told him that just because it's not his work doesn't mean bad but I have no idea if he listened. I just think he doesn't like the idea of working with a partner because he said in class one time he didn't understand the point of pair programming. I have low expectations for the next lab and I kind of hope this doesn't stay for the entirety of the class. I also just have been not feeling great in general so that definitely just doesn't help. Maybe I'll talk about it another time.
Perhaps remind your partner that in this class, the process is more important than the product. And if he thinks your writing could be improved, the best way to improve it is to do more of it.
